result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luis A. Garcia

records.addlTxt: 3:27 PM Defendant Luis A. Garcia appeared by video, in custody with interpreter Victor Gonzalez by video.  Attorney Katharine Cullen appeared by video for Luis A. Garcia.  Attorney David S Olson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond of $650.00 set with conditions of No contact directly or indirectly with victim ML, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:00am.
No contact directly or indirectly with victim M.L., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report
